arm_group.description: rTMS over Supplementary Motor Area, 1hz, no pauses, 20 minutes per sessions. Total: 20 sessions.
Sham stimulation, 20 minutes per session, total 20 sessions

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a study to evaluate the efficacy of rTMS for relief of obsessive-compulsive symptoms
      in patients with schizophrenia.

clinical_study.brief_title: Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (rTMS) as an add-on Treatment for Resistant Obsessive-compulsive Symptoms in Patients With Schizophrenia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosis of Schizophrenia (DSM-IV-TR)

          -  YBOCS > 16

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Mental Retardation

          -  Substance abuse

          -  Any contraindication to rTMS

intervention.description: rTMS over supplementary motor area, 1hz, no pauses, 20 minutes/sessions, 5 sessions/week, 4 weeks. Total 20 sessions.

facility.name: Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Obsessive Compulsive symptoms (using Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale - Y-BOCS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after 20 rTMS sessions (an expected average of 4 weeks), and 4 weeks after end of treatment

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Psychotic Symptoms (using Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale - BPRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after 20 rTMS sessions (an expected average of 4 weeks), and 4 weeks after end of treatment
Baseline, after 20 rTMS sessions (an expected average of 4 weeks), and 4 weeks after end of treatment

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

collaborator.agency: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
